ygData.messageBody:
Here's how I envision trade skills, and they would be damn usefull,
IMHO, were these ideas implemented.

Brewing: Yeah! We can get drunk! But shouldn't a master brewer be
able to make other items besides alchol? Perhaps an invigoring tonic
that restores stamina faster, or a healthy potion that gives a short
period of regeneration? (We could use troll chunks for this... yuck!)

Baking: Why can't we have a soup that cures disease or poision? The
possibilites with baking are endless with a little creativity and some
effort.

Pottery: Where are the sketches to make molds for weapons and armor?
Maybe a nice ceramic bow stave for the master fletcher around the way,
or ceramic arrow shafts/vanes?

Smithing: Weapons, armor, etc... Maybe allow the use of enchanted
metals for special armor and weapons. Steel Bow Staves? Steel arrow
heads? I'd buy them.

Fletching: Fix archery! Why would anyone buy an arrow that has a long
range when archery is so F^&%'d up, that it doesn't matter?

As it is, the trade skills do not even come close to generating anything
like a player based economy. Making the damn things usefull would
do wonders. I doubt Verant will ever do wonders.

I am presently in a suspended mode, evaluating if I should bother
playing again. Seeing the effects of the patches, I doubt I will.

(Micro Servo's no drop? WTF!)

Winvaras
Lv 20 Ranger
Master Brewer, Master Potter, Master Fletcher
Tarew Marr
